snippet: After 28 years of operation, the Pier 17 pavilion in Lower Manhattan has closed and will be demolished, but not before giving shoppers some final deals.
abstract: South Street Seaport's Pier 17 pavilion in Lower Manhattan closes after 28 years of operation; after being demolished, it will be replaced by a retail and entertainment center, with developers promising a greater emphasis on open space;  area eventually devolved into what critics feared it would always be: a suburban-style shopping center unworthy of its real estate.
lead_paragraph: After 28 years of operation, the Pier 17 pavilion in Lower Manhattan has closed and will be demolished, but not before giving shoppers some final deals.

headline.main: Sadness, and Bargains, as Mall at South Street Seaport Shuts Down
headline.print_headline: Sadness And Bargains As Mall at Pier Shuts Down
